dialogue: I checked the storage unit just now and noticed that one of the new artifacts went missing. You know{comma} the plinth?
Hey Cass{comma} I just noticed that the starry plinth is gone from storage. Any ideas as to where it went?
One of the artifacts was missing! Did you see where it went{comma} by any chance?
An important artifact in next week's exhibit is gone. Have you gone to the storage room recently?
Hey{comma} have you seen the starry plinth anywhere?
Have you seen Director Virgil?
I have to report the missing artifact to the director. Is there... anything I need to know?
I'm going to have to report the missing artifact to the director. Let me know if you learn anything new{comma} okay?
I'm going to go report the missing artifact to the director. I'll be right back.
Did you see anything in the security cameras by any chance?
I've been looking for Director Virgil for a while. Have you seen him by any chance? Cassandra said they talked yesterday afternoon{comma} but that's it...
I need to report that the plinth is gone. If he comes by{comma} let him know I need to see him.
I haven't called him yet. I'll let you know when I do.
Thanks{comma} Jonathan. I'll do that now.
I haven't called him yet...
Called him and it went straight to voice mail.
My call went straight to voice mail. Right when we need him the most{comma} am I right?
Thanks{comma} Jonathan.
Jonathan is letting me use his phone to call the director.
I called the director. It went straight to voice mail...
I called the director and it went straight to voice mail. Do you know where he is?
Hey{comma} I called Director Virgil with Jonathan's phone and he left me with a voice mail. It's unlike him.
Hey{comma} I called Director Virgil with Jonathan's phone and he left me with a voice mail. Do you know where he is?
So he hasn't contacted you since yesterday? That's really unlike him.
He hasn't contacted you since yesterday? You didn't bother reaching out or looking for him? That's your job.
He hasn't contacted you once? With the plinth missing{comma} you must be losing your mind{comma} then...
What do you think we should do?
What should we do... *visibly panic*
What should we do...
Well. I guess this is your problem now.
Sorry{comma} I was kidding.
I'll... I'll try to get to the bottom of this.
The director is missing! *cry*
Apparently{comma} Annie isn't able to contact the director today. I need your help to deal with the plinth while he's not here.
Please help me! I want to investigate in the director's office. Do you... have the keys?
Could you help me out? I'll investigate the director's office.
Even the assistant doesn't know where the director is. We're pretty much on our own in solving this problem{comma} for now.
I've confirmed with the assistant that she doesn't know where the director is. We have to solve this on our own.
Oh... can I have them?
Can you help me get into the director's office? To investigate.
Please! I'm begging you{comma} you have to help me out here! Is there anything I can do?!
Look{comma} my job is on the line too! My family... my life... if this artifact can't be found then why am I here?
Please? Maybe I can return the favor somehow. If we don't find that artifact{comma} all of us will get in trouble.
You know the director won't mind if it's an emergency. *This* is an emergency.
I'm sure you won't get in trouble if the director finds out. This is an emergency situation. Wouldn't you like it if he discovers *you* helped *me* find out where it is?
Losing an artifact so close to the exhibit... that's worse than letting me enter his office. Honestly{comma} if you won't help me{comma} you might get into worse trouble.
I'm helping you out too{comma} {assistant}. I... I see that Director Virgil overworks you. And I see that he's harsh on you...
Look{comma} I know the director treats you badly. What do you think will happen if he finds out you stood by while an important artifact is missing?
I hate to say this{comma} but if he's mean to you now... he might be meaner if you don't help me find this.
You might get in trouble if we don't find this either way. But if we find it... I'll make sure to give you the lion's share of the credit.
I got inside the director's office now.
I don't need you anymore. I got inside the director's office.
There's a key on the floor. Do you know whose it is?
I may have snooped through the director's safe and found a card from some woman. I have it here.
The director's safe was open and I saw a card of some woman named Beth. Of course{comma} I didn't take it... Do you know who Beth is?
The director's safe was open and I saw a card of some woman named Beth. Of course{comma} I didn't take it... Unless you want to see?
So I saw the card of from a woman named 'Beth' from the director's open safe. Do you know who that is?
After investigating the director's office I saw this card from 'Beth.' Do you know who that is?
Do you know anything about the woman that visits the director often?
I assume you see her often{comma} because she drops things off to you. What does she look like?
Cass thinks 'Beth' could be the rich woman that visits often. Do you know about that?
There was a woman in the storage room last night?! Why didn't you tell me?!
There was a woman in the storage room last night?!
What makes you think the woman in the cameras is 'Beth?'
I'll ask other people if they know about the director's situation. Maybe someone has talked to them within the day.
Can you help me out somehow? I want to investigate this.
Hmmph. Why did you tell me about it then? That information is useless.
Oh{comma} it's all right. Thanks for letting me know. I'll ask if the assistant or custodian can help me.
Ah{comma} the card does seem a little too affectionate.
The... Founder?
What kind of people does the director attract?
What do you think of the founder?
How do you know this?
Could 'Beth' possibly be the founder?
I asked Cassandra about 'Beth{comma}' too. She thinks it's the woman that always drops by the museum. Since you mostly guard the museum{comma} you must know what she looks like{comma} right?
Cassandra thinks that the woman in this card{comma} 'Beth{comma}' is a woman that often visits the museum{comma} and that she's also Beth.
Cassandra thinks that the woman in this card{comma} 'Beth{comma}' is the rich woman we talked about earlier.
I asked Cassandra about 'Beth{comma}' too. She thinks it's the woman that always drops by the museum. Plus{comma} the other staff talks about the same woman bringing gifts every time she drops by.
If we're working with the idea that Beth{comma} the founder{comma} and the director's lady visitor are all one and the same{comma} then you must have recognized her in the cameras.
I checked the footage at the time stamp you were talking about. There was no woman there.
Were you lying? There weren't any women in the security footage last night.
I'll be honest{comma} Jonathan. The fact that there was no woman at all makes me think that you want to throw the founder under the bus somehow. Why?
I take it you've heard about the director and Cassandra's fight?
Was there anyone or anything suspicious outside throughout the night? The director is complaining about the messy garden beds out front. It's normally not like that.
Are you hiding something{comma} Jonathan? The cameras didn't show anything. You were quick to throw the founder under the bus without any proof.
I'm trying to piece things together once and for all. The director asked me to{comma} after all that happened recently.
I assume you're heard of Cassandra's outburst a while ago? She stormed into the director's office looking for the plinth.
Do you have any idea why Cassandra would think badly of the director?
I've seen the calendar in your booth. Seems like you have a lot of bills that are past their due. Are you alright?
I'm sorry for this{comma} but I also saw that the 20th of April was marked as a birthday in your calendar. Do you know the director's daughter{comma} by any chance?
I guess I ask because I've noticed that you seem to talk about the director more casually.
I notice you sometimes accidentally mention him by name. No offense{comma} but usually security guards treat the director with more respect...

I notice how you often accidentally speak of him on a first-name basis. I mean{comma} you use 'Ma'am' with me and Cass all the time{comma} so it's curious how you mention the director by name when you don't do that to anyone else.
You seem to mention the director by his first name accidentally a lot. You also mentioned he trusts you... and that he's a private person. Do you guys know each other personally?
Is the director's... infatuation... the reason why you claimed to see a woman that looks like Beth in the security cameras?
Given that you're friends with the director{comma} do you know why he'd have tension with Cassandra? I've heard from staff that they often overhear them fight.
Why do you think framing the founder will "protect" the director?
But how does pointing fingers at the founder protect Director Virgil?
I'll ask other people{comma} then.
Looks like you're struggling financially.
It doesn't seem logical for the director to just discard the plinth just because he doesn't think it's important{comma} though.
Cassandra thinks that the woman in this card{comma} 'Beth{comma}' is a woman that often visits the museum.
Cassandra thinks that the woman in this card{comma} 'Beth{comma}' is the rich woman we talked about earlier.
Do you know why Cassandra went off on the director?
Did you know that Cassandra had threatened to quit multiple times? Have you heard of her reasons?
What do you know about the director and Cassandra's relationship as of late?
I'm trying to piece things together once and for all. The director asked me to{comma} after your little outburst.
I got into the director's office with the assistant's help. The director sure is harsh on her. She was terrified of getting in trouble.
I got into the director's office. The custodians helped me out... albeit unknowingly...
The custodian helped me get into the director's office. Wanna know what I found?
So what was that outburst about?
I heard you actually threatened to quit over your differences with the director. Is that true?
Why do you think the director would do that? He only has the museum's best interests at heart.
Why would the director do that?
You confronted the director because of the plinth... then is it reasonable to assume you threatened to quit because of that too?
Since when were you having these problems with the director?
I see. What did he want to do with it?
Does the founder have anything to do with this?
I heard from the custodians that they overheard Cassandra threatening to quit. Did you know about this?
Does Cassandra know about this?
If it's unimportant{comma} what did the director plan on doing with it?
Why the founder{comma} specifically?
The founder... do you think it's the rich woman visiting the director?
Hey Cass. What's up with your arm?
What? I'll let the custodians know that we need to fix that.
Gee{comma} okay{comma} I'll let the director know that he needs to replace that cabinet.
Is everything okay with the two of you?
Why in the world will he want to sell the plinth?
There's no way he'll sell the plinth. You're crazy.
Who would he even sell that to?
When did you get that injury?
Ah{comma} right. Then you were probably too busy with the dagger when the plinth disappeared.
I see{comma} I see. Jonathan actually told me about a woman in the cameras of the storage room. Have you seen anyone else in the second floor as you worked?
Actually{comma} Jonathan said he saw a woman in the storage room cameras... Maybe you know something about that?
Where were you when the plinth disappeared{comma} approximately around past midnight?
I see. It's probably not relevant to the missing plinth{comma} then.
I see. That's all I got to say about that for now.
I wanna talk about your injury again.
I found a bloodied tissue in the bathrooms. The wound bled that much?
What's up with the bloody flower in the trash?
I talked to both of the custodians{comma} and I've been told that they talked to you during closing time and didn't see any scratches on you.
I fished this out of the trash. (You show her the bloody flower) Why would there be a flower in the trash{comma} and why would it have blood on it?
You told the custodians to avoid tidying up the office because you'll be staying in the museum to research overnight. You weren't injured then.
I was told you requested the custodians to avoid tidying the office before they leave because you're staying here overnight.
The timing of your cut wasn't consistent. What's the truth?
Jonathan told me you were injured{comma} but he said he saw you on his visit to the curator's office{comma} two hours after closing.
Why did Jonathan visit you that night? I'd like to hear your side.
Why would you lie about that?
But the cause is still the same? The broken steel cabinet cut you?
What about the flower? Why did it end up in the trash?
Let's talk about your cut again. You better not be lying this time.
I want to talk about your cut again. I've discovered new information.
This flower comes from the shrubs outside. Interestingly enough{comma} before everyone left{comma} the garden bed was undisturbed.
The shrubs that this flower comes from is thorny.

This flower comes from the shrubs outside. Interestingly enough{comma} before everyone left{comma} the garden bed was undisturbed. Plus{comma} I've checked and saw that this shrub is filled with large thorns.
Tell me the truth{comma} Cass. Did you mess with the garden bushes outside?
Why would you do that? You've gotten yourself hurt in the process.
A... time capsule?
Wha-why would you bury a time capsule in a museum of all places? And why in the middle of the night.
I saw a key to the storage unit in the director's office. Do you know whose key this is?
How did your key get into the director's office?
Do you think... the director took them?
I found Cass's keys in the director's office. Strange{comma} isn't it?
I found Cass's keys in the director's office. I'm just going to come out and say it--do you think the director stole them? You know him well enough.
Cass's keys are in the director's office. I know you're closer to the director than all of us combined{comma} so... do you know how it got there?
Where were you at the time that the plinth disappeared?
About how many times were you visiting{comma} and why?
Did you notice that Cass was injured then?
At which visit did you notice Cass's injury?
Why did you visit those two times?
You did have a lot of books about Port Vonn in your booth. I believe you for the first visit.
I did talk to Cass about the woman in the cameras{comma} but she doesn't know what that was about.
But there wasn't a woman in the cameras.
Where could Cass have been in your second visit?
Did you know about Cassandra's injury? She said she got it before the museum closed{comma} the night of the plinth's disappearance.
A steel cabinet in the storage room cut Cass's arm. You should get that fixed. I'll ask the director about it too.
She did that?! It doesn't feel possible{comma} she loved the museum.
I have to ask someone else about this{comma} if you're sure you overheard that. (Leave)
I need some help with finding the director. I need clues.
So how was your weekend{comma} {activeNPC}?
I'm glad that it was good. What were you doing the entire weekend?
Are you sure you don't want to help? I promise I'll just borrow the keys just this once! It's an emergency!
Ah{comma} that's... too bad. I'm sorry I asked. Did you do something any way?
Woah{comma} that's cute! Do you mostly just bake for family?
What about knitting makes you enjoy it? I'm curious.
I see. Where do you often fish?
Oh{comma} I'm sorry I asked! Did you at least do something in that time?
Oh wow! Can you bake for me?
I want to talk about your family.
Can you make me a sweater?
I actually started to wonder: does knitting make holiday gifts any easier?
I'm glad your family appreciates them. I would too{comma} since you probably hand-made them with love.
Awww{comma} I'm sure your daughter appreciates all the gifts you have given her through the years.
You knit for her birthday as well{comma} right? How{comma} when I see you so often in the museum cleaning up the mess made by the tourists?
What happens when your daughter's birthday falls on a weekday?
Do you pick up the slack when {id:NPCInteraction_Floor1_custodian_0} goes home during his daughter's birthday?
I actually want to try fishing. Though... I don't know where to begin.
I actually want to try knitting. It seems pretty time consuming though. Any tips?
I actually want to try baking. How did you get started?
I actually want to try writing. I'm bad at it{comma} though.
What about your family? Who are you closest to?
Oh{comma} you have sisters! Do you have other family?
Are you knitting something for her upcoming birthday{comma} then?
Are you baking something for her upcoming birthday{comma} then?
Is there something you want to do for her birthday?
Why do you think that of the founder?
Here's the key I found in the director's office. Do you know whose key it is?
Hey{comma} {id:NPCInteraction_Floor2_assistant_0}. Do you happen to know when {id:NPCInteraction_Floor1_custodian_0} asked for a short work day?
When was the last time you helped him out then?
I heard from {id:NPCInteraction_Floor1_custodian_0} that you talked to Cassandra the night the plinth went missing. She was injured at the time.
The plinth for the Aurora exhibit is missing{comma} so I was hoping to report it.
I found this key in the director's office. Do you know whose key it is?
Y-you're right. I'll go see what I can do.
Really? How do I get them?
I know you're terrified of him. He's harsh on you. Do you really think he won't blame you for losing an important artifact?
Did you see the director bring something into the storage room?
I found the statue to the missing plinth. Here it is.
Isn't this the statue to the missing plinth?
I found a statue in the storage room.
I found it in the storage room.
Apparently the statue was brought by the director. It was... from the founder.
Your accusations hold no water. I just learned that the director *brought* the statue. Why would he bring the statue if he would sell the plinth?
I found out that Beth is the name of the founder.
You were right -- Beth is the name of the museum's founder.
Do you happen to know anything about director Virgil's relationship with his wife?
I just heard a little voicemail while investigating the director's office. They seem to have some marital troubles. Do you happen to know why?
Just a shot in the dark. I know you're close with the director{comma} so I was wondering if you knew anything.
Just a shot in the dark.
I checked the cameras. Sorry if I didn't ask. There appears to be no suspicious person in the storage area at the time of the plinth's disappearance.
I notice the door to the director's office is locked. Did you lock it?
Were you in the director's office recently? I was going to check for clues{comma} but it's locked.
Do you happen to have a key to the director's office? It's locked.
Can you open the director's office for me?
When you last went to the office{comma} did you find anything suspicious?
Can you help me get into the office?
I heard the assistant gave a key to the director's office to one of you guys. The door is locked{comma} so... Can I have them?
